intro: Saprosma urophylla, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Saprosma urophylla thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of Hawaii.
